title: Break Through the Mists of Pandaria Classic on July 21
summary: Mists of Pandaria Classic launches July 21. A pre-patch arrives the week of July 1, introducing the Pandaren race and Monk class to modern WoW, alongside the Theramore's Fall scenario and Pet Battles. Completing the Pandaren starting experience by July 30 in MoP Classic earns the Shaohao's Sage Serpent mount in modern WoW. Mogu'shan Vaults raid opens July 31.

title: Mists of Pandaria Classic: A Profession Primer
summary: The blog post details professions in Mists of Pandaria, focusing on the new crafting material, Spirit of Harmony. This BoP material is used across many professions for epic items, recipes, and vendor purchases. Alchemy introduces Golden Lotus and Alchemist Stones. Blacksmithing, Leatherworking, and Tailoring utilize Spirit of Harmony for PvP/dungeon gear and raid recipes using Blood Spirit. Enchanting reduces glow effects. Engineering gains new mounts, the Goblin Glider, and the Blingtron 4000. Herbalism features Golden Lotus and new herbs like Silkweed. Mining introduces Ghost Iron and Trillium. Skinning offers Exotic Leather. Jewelcrafting has discovery recipes and new Panther mounts. Inscription focuses on glyphs and shoulder enchants, with Staves and Fans as new crafted items. Secondary professions include improved bandages for First Aid, new fishing activities, expanded Archaeology digsites, and specialized Cooking recipes.

title: Journey Through the Wandering Isle and Take on the Way of the Monk
summary:
The Mists of Pandaria pre-expansion patch introduced Pandaren and the Monk class.

Pandaren start on the Wandering Isle, a giant turtle, learning their culture of balance and harmony. Players level to 10 before choosing between the Alliance or Horde.

Monks are available to many races and feature three specializations: Brewmaster (tank), Mistweaver (healer), and Windwalker (damage). They utilize energy and chi, with high mobility.

The Pandaren's story involves healing the Wandering Isle from an infection, prompting their decision to join the major factions.

Monk.summary: The Monk class, uniquely tied to the Pandaren narrative, emphasizes discipline, balance, and physical mastery. * Monks utilize energy and chi to power their abilities, excelling in mobility with skills like Roll and Flying Serpent Kick. * Brewmaster monks tank by delaying damage with Stagger, showcasing resilience and cleverness. * Mistweaver monks are hybrid healers, blending melee abilities with restorative spells. * Windwalker monks are damage dealers focused on precise, explosive combos. The Monk class is available to Pandaren, Human, Orc, Dwarf, Tauren, Gnome, Troll, Draenei, and Blood Elf races.

title: Mists of Pandaria Classic: Enter the Mogu’shan Vaults Raid July 31!
summary: Mogu'shan Vaults, a raid exploring the Mogu empire's secrets, becomes available on July 31st. Bosses include the Stone Guard, Feng the Accursed, Gara'jal the Spiritbinder, the Spirit Kings, Elegon, and the Will of the Emperor. Players can earn achievements by completing encounters and specific challenges.

title: Hotfixes: June 24, 2025
summary:
Hotfixes for The War Within include:

*   **Achievements**: "I'm Bringing Nerub-ack" and "Can You Please Spell 'Gobanna?'" now count towards "Azeroth's Next Top Model".
*   **Delves**: Overcharged Titan Console now spawns in Shadow Realm. Some Durable Information Storage Container belt effects were adjusted.
*   **Items**: Fixed an issue with BFA Timewalking drops having higher stats than intended.
*   **Lorewalking**: Resolved issues with players getting stuck in Ny'alotha and being incorrectly teleported to Dalaran.
*   **Classes**: Tank specializations received a 15% threat generation increase. Paladin, Shaman, Evoker, Hunter, Mage, Priest, Rogue, Warlock, and Warrior saw various ability and talent adjustments.
*   **Player vs. Player**: Numerous PvP talent and ability tuning changes were implemented across multiple classes.
*   **Nightfall Event**: Flame's Radiance reputation gains increased by 100%.

Warrior.summary:
• Arms Warrior: Whirlwind damage increased by 100%.
  • Fury Warrior: Whirlwind damage increased by 120%, Thunder Clap damage increased by 25%, Odyn’s Fury damage increased by 30%, and Mountain Thane: Thunder Blast damage increased by 25%.
  • Arms Warrior: Execute damage reduced by 15% in PvP combat. Rend damage increased by 15% in PvP combat.
  • Protection Warrior: Fixed a bug causing Shield Charge to deal damage extra times or to targets near their starting position.
  • Arms Warrior: Colossus Smash can no longer be parried.

Mage.summary: • Frost Mage all damage increased by 3% (PvP excluded).

Rogue.summary:
• Subtlety Rogue: All damage increased by 5% (PvE only).
  • Outlaw Rogue: Combat Stamina now increases Stamina by 18% in PvP combat (was 12%).
  • Assassination Rogue: Kingsbane can no longer be parried.
  • Outlaw Rogue: Fixed an issue where Blade Flurry could strike fewer than the maximum available targets near dead enemies. Also fixed an issue with Deft Maneuvers talent, and ensured Roll the Bones' Grand Melee buff dynamically updated Blade Flurry's damage.
  • Subtlety Rogue: Fixed an issue where Nimble Flurry could strike fewer than the maximum available targets near dead enemies.
  • Trickster Rogue: Fixed an issue preventing Blade Flurry and Nimble Flurry from dealing increased damage to targets with the Fazed debuff.

Priest.summary:
• Shadow Priest: Psychic Link now causes direct damage to inflict 35% of damage dealt to targets afflicted by Vampiric Touch (was 30%).
  • Shadow Priest: Halo damage increased by 30%.
  • Shadow Priest: Voidweaver: Entropic Rift damage increased by 12%.
  • Discipline Priest: Power Word: Radiance healing is no longer reduced by 10% in PvP combat.
  • Discipline Priest: Ultimate Penitence damage and healing increased by 35% in PvP combat.
  • Holy Priest: Prayer of Healing will no longer be displayed on the Cooldown Manager when not talented.
  • Discipline Priest: Resolved an issue causing the Cooldown Manager to track the duration of Power Word: Shield on the Priest instead of tracking its cooldown.

Paladin.summary:
*   **June 20, 2025:** Resolved an issue where Divine Hammer and Shield of the Righteous did not cast Empyrean Hammer.
*   **May 27, 2025:** Lightsmith: Blessing of the Forge healing increased by 15%; Hammer and Anvil healing increased by 20%.
*   **May 22, 2025:** Resolved an issue causing Avenging Wrath to not function properly when talented into Radiant Glory.
*   **May 16, 2025:** Resolved an issue with the Radiant Glory and Avenging Wrath interaction.
*   **May 9, 2025:** Sunlight now correctly benefits from the Scarlet Enclave Shockadin 6-set bonus.
*   **May 8, 2025:** Added support for Sentinel and several PvP talents to the Cooldown Manager for Protection Paladins.
*   **May 5, 2025:** The Scarlet Enclave Protection 6-set bonus now correctly allows the use of Avenging Wrath while under the effects of Forbearance.
*   **April 30, 2025:** The Avenging Shield buff granted from the Scarlet Enclave 6-piece set bonus for Protection Paladins correctly lasts the same duration as Avenging Wrath.

Hunter.summary:
• Survival Hunters: Explosive Shot damage increased by 15%.
  • Survival Hunters: Fury of the Eagle damage increased by 25%.
  • Marksmanship Hunters: Fixed an issue where dying while channeling Rapid Fire could keep Hunters in combat upon resurrecting.
  • Survival Hunters: Fixed an issue where Aspect of the Eagle variants of Raptor Strike and Mongoose Bite were dealing less damage than intended.
  • Survival Hunters: Fixed an issue where casting Coordinated Assault at greater than 30 yards away could grant Howl of the Pack Leader twice.
  • Survival Hunters: Fixed an issue where Aspect of the Eagle was not correctly extending the range of Spirit Bond.
  • PvP: Marksmanship Hunters: Spotter's Marks applied via Ohn'ahran Winds will now correctly obey PvP mults.
  • PvP: Hunters: Master's Call now applies its effect to you and your pet when targeting your own pet.
  • PvP: Hunters: Master's Call now correctly applies to you and your pet if you are targeting an enemy.
  • PvP: Hunters: Master's Call now correctly applies to you and your pet if you are targeting nothing.
  • PvP: Hunters: Command Pet will now maintain its overridden spell when entering arenas and other instances.
  • PvP: Survival Hunters: Fixed an issue causing Raptor Strike and Mongoose Bite to not deal damage when cast onto targets in breakable crowd control.
  • PvP: Survival Hunters: Flanking Strike will now correctly fail to cast and not go on cooldown if your pet is rooted or crowd-controlled.

Warlock.summary:
• Hellcaller Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Vile Taint would trigger Blackened Soul more times than intended.
  • Destruction Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Crashing Chaos would persist after the start of a Mythic+ run.
  • Warlock PvP: Demon Skin's armor increase is now 30% more effective in PvP combat.
  • Hellcaller Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Blackened Soul would not generate a stack if two Soul Shard spenders were cast in quick succession.
  • Hellcaller Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Wither would not pandemic when refreshed with no stacks.
  • Demonology Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Shadow Bolt would appear on the essential cooldown bar without Diabolic Ritual being learned.
  • Demonology Warlocks: Fixed an issue where Hand of Gul'dan would appear on the essential cooldown bar without Secrets of the Coven being learned.

title: Embrace the Heat During the Midsummer Fire Festival
summary: The Midsummer Fire Festival runs June 21 - July 5. New for 2025, it extends to Khaz Algar with new zone achievements and transmog items. A new vendor offers transmog pieces, and Frost Lord Ahune has new cosmetic drops. Players can fight Ahune daily for loot, complete quests for Burning Blossoms, and desecrate or honor bonfires across Azeroth's zones for achievements. Completing specific sets of achievements earns the "Flame Keeper" or "Flame Warden" titles. Several new pets and cosmetic items are available.

Warrior.summary:
New for 2025, the Midsummer Fire Festival expands to Khaz Algar with new faction achievements. Holiday vendors offer transmog gear: Grand Helm, Grand Mantle, and Grand Belt of the Fire Festival. Frost Lord Ahune will drop new cosmetic items, including the Crown of the Frost Lord and two-hand polearms/staves such as Glazfuris and Rethfuras.

Players can earn Burning Blossoms by completing daily quests and participating in events. The holiday boss, Ahune, can be challenged daily via the Group Finder for a Satchel of Chilled Goods. The event features achievements for desecrating and honoring bonfires across various continents and expansions, culminating in meta-achievements like "The Flame Keeper" or "The Flame Warden" which grant titles. Other achievements involve torch juggling, dancing at ribbon poles, and stealing flames from enemy capital cities. New pets include Igneous Flameling, Frigid Frostling, Spirit of Summer, and Blazing Cindercrawler. Players can also acquire new cosmetic sets, heirlooms, and toys.

Mage.summary:
The Midsummer Fire Festival in The War Within introduces new content for Khaz Algar, including faction achievements like "Flame Keeper of Khaz Algar" and "Flame Warden of Khaz Algar."

New transmog items available from the holiday vendor include the Grand Helm, Grand Mantle, and Grand Belt of the Fire Festival. Frost Lord Ahune will drop new cosmetic items: the Crown of the Frost Lord, Glazfuris (Two-Hand Polearm), Rethfuras (Two-Hand Polearm), Glazfuris (Two-Hand Staff), and Rethfuras (Two-Hand Staff).

The event also features activities such as defeating Ahune for a daily reward and completing quests for experience, gold, and Burning Blossoms. A significant portion of the achievements involves honoring and desecrating bonfires across various zones, including the new Khaz Algar zones. Completing specific sets of these achievements grants meta-achievements like "The Fires of Azeroth" and ultimately "The Flame Keeper" (Horde) or "The Flame Warden" (Alliance) titles. Other achievements include "Torch Juggler," "Ice the Frost Lord," "King of the Fire Festival," and "Burning Hot Pole Dance."

New pets include the Igneous Flameling, Frigid Frostling, Spirit of Summer, and Blazing Cindercrawler. Cosmetic items like the Mantle of the Fire Festival, Vestments of Summer, Sandals of Summer, Helm of the Fire Festival, and Tabards of Summer are available, alongside heirlooms and toys.

title: WoWCast: Immerse Yourself in the Ghosts of K’aresh Content Update
summary:
The Ghosts of K'aresh update for The War Within continues the campaign, introducing the shattered world of K'aresh as a new zone.

Key additions include:

  • Tazavesh, the Veiled Market as a new city hub.
  • Manaforge Omega raid.
  • Upgradeable Reshii Wraps artifact and Phase Diving.
  • The Archival Assault Delve and the Ecological Succession system.
  • New dungeon Eco-Dome Al'dani and an updated dungeon pool for Season 3, with Tazavesh returning as a Mega-dungeon.
  • Class updates and new class sets tied to Hero Talents.
  • PvP updates and a new outdoor PvP location.

Warrior.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Mage.summary: • The Mage class will receive new Class Sets with set bonuses that align with Hero Talents, rather than traditional specializations.

Rogue.summary:
• Reshii Wraps: An upgradeable artifact cloak that allows Rogues to transform into an energy form.
  • Phase Diving: A new open-world content type accessed via the Reshii Wraps, featuring new creatures, objectives, world quests, and mechanics like "Warrants."
  • Tazavesh, the Veiled Market: Returns as a hub city and also features two dungeons: "Tazavesh Streets of Wonder" and "Tazavesh So'leah's Gambit" in the Season 3 Mythic+ dungeon pool.
  • Class Updates: Specific Rogue specializations may receive updates, though not explicitly detailed for Rogues in this excerpt.
  • New Class Sets: Rogues will receive new class gear with set bonuses that align with their chosen Hero Talents.
  • PvP Updates: Several PvP talents will be updated, and a new outdoor PvP zone, "Vanquisher's Wake," will be available.

Priest.summary:
• Shadow Priest receives gameplay updates in the Ghosts of K’aresh content update.
  • New class sets will be available, with set bonuses aligning to Hero Talents rather than specializations.

Paladin.summary:
The Ghosts of K'aresh update continues The War Within campaign, introducing the shattered world of K'aresh as a new zone and Tazavesh, the Veiled Market, as a city hub. Players will confront Dimensius, the All-Devouring, and his followers.

Key additions for Paladins include:

*   **New Upgradeable Artifact: Reshii Wraps:** This artifact cloak allows players to transform into an energy form, enabling new gameplay mechanics like Phase Diving and interaction within various content such as the Manaforge Omega raid, open world, and delves. The Reshii Wraps will scale and visually update as players progress.
*   **New Class Updates:** Specific class updates are mentioned, but Paladin-specific details are not provided in this text.
*   **New Class Sets:** New class gear sets will feature set bonuses that align with chosen Hero Talents, rather than class or specialization.

Death Knight.summary:
-   **Frost Death Knight** and **Unholy Death Knight** will receive class updates focusing on new gameplay for their specializations.
-   New tier sets will be available, with set bonuses aligning with Hero Talents rather than traditional class or specialization.

Druid.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Monk.summary:
• Brewmaster Monk is receiving class updates in Ghosts of K’aresh.
  • New class sets will align set bonuses with Hero Talents, not specialization.

Delves.summary:
*   **The Archival Assault** is a new Delve located in the Azure Vaults on the Dragon Isles.
*   Players will encounter ethereals, ethereal pirates, and brokers who are plundering this Delve.
*   The use of **Reshii Wraps** will unlock unique challenge gateways to bosses and challenge rooms within The Archival Assault.
*   Players may encounter the ghosts of fallen friends within the Delve.
*   A boss encounter with **Nexus Princess Ky’veza** will be featured in this season's Delve.

Raiding.summary:
• The new raid, Manaforge Omega, is a massive facility where players will fight Shadow Guard Ethereals attempting to revive Dimensius.
  • Players will ultimately confront Dimensius in a cosmic battle within this raid.
  • The Reshii Wraps artifact can be used in the Manaforge Omega raid.
  • Tazavesh, the Veiled Market, previously a dungeon, will now serve as a home base for adventurers.

M+.summary:
• The War Within Season 3 introduces Eco-Dome Al’dani as a new dungeon.
  • The Mythic+ dungeon pool for Season 3 will include:
    • Returning: Halls of Atonement, Tazavesh: Streets of Wonder, Tazavesh: So’leah’s Gambit, Ara-Kara: City of Echoes, The Dawnbreaker, Priory of the Sacred Flame, Operation Floodgate.
    • New: Eco-Dome Al’dani.
  • Tazavesh, the Veiled Market, will also be available as a full Mega-dungeon.
  • Checkpoints in dungeons are being updated and will be visually represented as Waystones on the map.

PvP.summary:
• Several PvP talents will receive updates.
  • A new World Quest, "Vanquisher's Wake," will be available on an island for outdoor PvP battles.
  • Entry to Vanquisher's Wake does not require a quest; players can enter with War Mode enabled.

Open World.summary:
The Ghosts of K’aresh content update introduces a new zone, K’aresh, the fragmented homeworld of the ethereals, which players can explore.

  • Players continue The War Within campaign, aiding Alleria Windrunner and Locus-Walker against Dimensius.
  • Tazavesh, the Veiled Market returns as a city hub for adventurers.
  • The artifact, Reshii Wraps, allows players to engage in Phase Diving, a new overlay of K’aresh featuring unique creatures, objectives, and world quests like "Warrants" for hunting notorious monsters.
  • The Ecological Succession system involves restoring K’aresh's eco-domes by collecting and relocating creatures from other zones.
  • A new World Quest is added to Vanquisher's Wake island for outdoor PvP.

title: Go on an Adventure in the Legacy of Arathor Content Update—Now Live!
summary: The "Legacy of Arathor" update arrives June 17th, bringing a new Arathi Highlands campaign with branching faction viewpoints. Players can experience lore with Lorewalker Cho, tackle enhanced Overcharged Delves with new affixes and trait trees, and utilize new UI options like Assisted Highlight and Single-Button Assistant. Turbulent Timeways will feature Battle for Azeroth dungeons, and the Greedy Emissary event returns with new rewards including mount and recolored Tier 2 armor.

The Single-Button Assistant will also be available, allowing players to cast a sequence of recommended damage abilities with a single button press, with a slight additional global cooldown between casts.

  • Tier 2 Armor Set Recolors: Mage armor sets will receive recolors as part of the Greedy Emissary event rewards.

title: Take a Timely Tour Through the Turbulent Timeways
summary: A seven-week Timewalking event begins, featuring six Battle for Azeroth dungeons. Players earn a stacking experience buff ("Knowledge of the Timeways," up to 30%) and can achieve "Mastery of the Timeways" for five weeks to earn the Chrono Corsair mount. Timewalking dungeons scale enemies and loot to player level. Dungeons drop Heroic-level gear and grant reputation bonuses for the corresponding expansion. The event also includes a new Battle for Azeroth vendor and a temporary quest offering increased rewards.

Warrior.summary:
The Turbulent Timeways event focuses on Battle for Azeroth Timewalking dungeons.
  • Six Battle for Azeroth dungeons are available: Atal'Dazar, Freehold, King's Rest, Shrine of the Storm, Temple of Sethraliss, and Waycrest Manor.
  • Completing Timewalking dungeons grants "Knowledge of the Timeways," a stacking buff increasing experience gains by 5% per stack, up to 30% after four stacks ("Mastery of the Timeways").
  • This buff is account-wide and persists through death.
  • The "Master of the Turbulent Timeways III" achievement rewards a new mount for maintaining "Mastery of the Timeways" for five weeks.
  • A Battle for Azeroth Timewalking vendor is available in Boralus and Dazar'Alor.
  • The weekly Timewalking quest offers an increased reward: a Heroic Cache of Undermine Treasures (item levels 649-658).
  • Reputation gains from quests and creature kills related to Battle for Azeroth are increased by 50% during the event.

Mage.summary: No Mage-specific content was found in this blog post.

Rogue.summary:
The current Timewalking event features a seven-week rotation of past expansion dungeons.

For Rogues, the Battle for Azeroth Timewalking weeks (June 17 and July 29) include dungeons like Freehold and Waycrest Manor.
The Mists of Pandaria Timewalking week (June 24) includes dungeons like Shado-Pan Monastery.
The Burning Crusade Timewalking week (July 1) includes dungeons like Magister's Terrace.
The Warlords of Draenor Timewalking week (July 8) includes dungeons like Grimrail Depot.
The Legion Timewalking week (July 15) includes dungeons like Court of Stars.

The event also offers a stacking buff, "Knowledge of the Timeways," which increases experience gains and can be upgraded to "Mastery of the Timeways" after five weeks, rewarding a Chrono Corsair mount.

The "Turbulent Timeways" event features a weekly rotation of Timewalking dungeons from past expansions, starting with Battle for Azeroth (June 17-24). This includes six specific BfA dungeons: Atal'Dazar, Freehold, King's Rest, Shrine of the Storm, Temple of Sethraliss, and Waycrest Manor.

During the event, players will receive a "Knowledge of the Timeways" buff, increasing experience gain from monsters and quests by 5%, which stacks to 30% after four applications, becoming "Mastery of the Timeways." This buff is account-wide and persists through death, aiding alt leveling.

A new Battle for Azeroth vendor will be available in Boralus and Dazar'Alor. The weekly Timewalking quest offers an enhanced reward: a Heroic Cache of Undermine Treasures (items level 649-658) for a limited time.

Completing the "Master of the Turbulent Timeways III" achievement, earned by maintaining "Mastery of the Timeways" for five weeks, grants the new Chrono Corsair mount. Previous rewards, like the Timely Buzzbee mount, will also be available from the Timewalking vendor.

Timewalking dungeons scale enemies and loot to player level, offering a chance at Heroic item drops and awarding reputation with relevant factions. Additionally, all reputations from the corresponding expansion will grant a 50% bonus from quests and creature kills while Timewalking is active. The event continues with Mists of Pandaria, The Burning Crusade, Warlords of Draenor, Legion, and Classic Timewalking dungeons in subsequent weeks.

title: WoW Classic 20th Anniversary Edition Phase 5 Launches July 10
summary: The War Effort begins July 10th, enabling players to contribute resources to open the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj. Completing the "Bang a Gong!" quest first earns the Black Qiraji Resonating Crystal mount and triggers a 10-hour window for others to obtain it. This unlocks the 20-player Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj and 40-player Temple of Ahn'Qiraj raids, featuring new class armor sets and the "Treasures of the Timeless One" epic weapon quest.

Warrior.summary:
• The War Effort requires players to turn in supplies to open the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj.
  • Warriors can turn in Commendations to War Effort Commanders for their faction.
  • Completing the "Scepter of the Shifting Sands" questline and the "Bang a Gong!" quest grants the Black Qiraji Resonating Crystal mount.
  • Warriors can obtain the Conqueror's Battlegear set from the Temple of Ahn'Qiraj and the Battlegear of Unyielding Strength set (Ring, Cloak, 1H Axe) from the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj.

Mage.summary:
• Mages can obtain two new class armor sets:
    • Trappings of Vaulted Secrets from Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj, including a ring, cloak, and 1H sword.
    • Enigma Vestments (boots, circlet, leggings, robes, shoulderpads) from Temple of Ahn'Qiraj, acquired through reputation with the Brood of Nozdormu and raid tokens.

Rogue.summary:
• Rogues can obtain the Emblems of Veiled Shadows set from Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj, which includes a ring, cloak, and dagger.
  • The Deathdealer's Embrace set, a Tier 2.5 raid set, is available from Temple of Ahn'Qiraj. This set includes boots, helm, spaulders, leggings, and vest.

Priest.summary:
• Priests can obtain the Finery of Infinite Wisdom set (Ring, Cloak, 1H Mace) from the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj.
  • Priests can obtain the Garments of the Oracle set (Boots, Mantle, Tiara, Trousers, Vestments) from the Temple of Ahn'Qiraj by collecting Qiraji Tokens, Idols, and Scarabs, and reaching reputation with the Brood of Nozdormu.

Paladin.summary:
Paladins can obtain two new armor sets:

*   **Battlegear of Eternal Justice:** Acquired from the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj, this set includes a ring, cloak, and a 1H sword.
*   **Avenger's Battlegear:** This set, consisting of a breastplate, crown, greaves, leggings, and pauldrons, is obtained from the Temple of Ahn'Qiraj and requires collecting Qiraji Tokens, Idols, and Scarabs, along with gaining reputation with the Brood of Nozdormu.

Hunter.summary:
• Hunters can obtain the Tier 2.5 armor set, "Trappings of the Unseen Path," from the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj (20-player raid).
  • This set includes a ring (Signet of the Unseen Path), a cloak (Cloak of the Unseen Path), and a 1H Axe (Scythe of the Unseen Path).
  • The Tier 2.5 raid set, "Striker's Guard," is acquired from the Temple of Ahn'Qiraj (40-player raid) and includes armor pieces: Striker's Diadem, Striker's Footguards, Striker's Hauberk, Striker's Leggings, and Striker's Pauldrons.
  • Acquiring these sets requires collecting Qiraji Tokens, class-specific Idols, and Scarabs from the raids, in addition to reaching specific Reputation levels with the Brood of Nozdormu.

The Genesis Raiment set is available from the Temple of Ahn'Qiraj and includes Genesis Boots, Genesis Helm, Genesis Shoulderpads, Genesis Trousers, and Genesis Vest.

Raiding.summary:
The War Effort begins July 10th, requiring players to contribute resources to unlock the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj (20-player) and Temple of Ahn'Qiraj (40-player) raids.

*   **War Effort Contribution:** Factions must turn in large quantities of supplies. If requirements aren't met within 15 days of unlock, automatic low-level contributions will begin.
*   **"Bang a Gong!" Quest:** The first player to complete the "Scepter of the Shifting Sands" questline and turn in "Bang a Gong!" will open the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj for the server and receive the Black Qiraji Resonating Crystal mount.
*   **Ten Hour War:** After the gong is rung, a 10-hour window opens for players to complete the questline and obtain the mount. Raid access begins after this window.
*   **"Treasures of the Timeless One":** Players who complete "The Might of Kalimdor" questline (part of the Scepter of the Shifting Sands) are eligible for this quest, which rewards a choice of epic weapons.
*   **Raid Content:**
    *   **Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj:** 20-player raid with 6 bosses. Requires level 60 and Cenarion Circle reputation.
    *   **Temple of Ahn'Qiraj:** 40-player raid with 9 bosses. Requires level 60 and Brood of Nozdormu reputation.
*   **New Class Armor Sets:**
    *   Tier 2.5 raid sets are obtainable from both Ahn'Qiraj raids through boss loot, Qiraji Tokens, Idols, and Scarabs, along with reputation with the Brood of Nozdormu.
    *   Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj drops items for specific slots (rings, cloaks, 1H weapons) and pieces for sets like Genesis Raiment (Druid) and Striker's Guard (Hunter).
    *   Temple of Ahn'Qiraj drops full set pieces for all classes, such as Avenger's Battlegear (Paladin) and Conqueror's Battlegear (Warrior).

PvP.summary: Please refer to the general summary.

Open World.summary:
The War Effort begins July 10th, requiring players to turn in vast amounts of supplies to open the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj.
The first player to complete the "Bang a Gong!" quest after the gates open will receive the Black Qiraji Resonating Crystal mount.
A 10-hour window follows the gong ringing, during which players can complete quests and earn the mount.
After this window, the Ruins of Ahn'Qiraj (20-player) and Temple of Ahn'Qiraj (40-player) raids will become available.
Players who complete the "Scepter of the Shifting Sands" questline, but not "Bang a Gong!" in time, can still earn an epic weapon through the "Treasures of the Timeless One" quest.
New Tier 2.5 armor sets can be obtained from both raid instances, requiring reputation with the Brood of Nozdormu and specific tokens.

title: Legacy of Arathor Update Notes
summary: The Legacy of Arathor update introduces a new campaign questline, "Rise of the Red Dawn," with faction-specific rewards. Players can now "Lorewalk" with Lorewalker Cho, revisiting iconic Azerothian moments with new toys as rewards. Overcharged Delves offer increased challenge and new rewards, including a mount. UI enhancements include Assisted Highlight and a Single-Button Assistant for improved gameplay guidance. Battle for Azeroth Timewalking dungeons are added, alongside Timewalking dungeon adjustments to increase difficulty and reward Timewarped Badges. The Greedy Emissary event returns with enhanced Treasure Goblins and legacy loot buffs. A new class ability, "Recuperate," is added.

*   New Ability: Recuperate - Restores 50% of maximum health over 10 seconds.

Mage.summary:

title: Legacy of Arathor: Get an Assist With New UI Options
summary:
Legacy of Arathor introduces two UI options to assist players.

Assisted Highlight suggests the next recommended damage ability, helping new players or those trying new specs. It focuses only on DPS abilities.

Single-Button Assistant casts the next recommended damage ability with a single button press, including AoE when appropriate. A small global cooldown is added between uses. It’s designed for a more casual experience.

These features aim to lower the barrier to entry and improve accessibility.

Warrior.summary: The Legacy of Arathor update introduces two UI features to assist players with rotations: * Assisted Highlight: This option highlights the next recommended damage ability based on your character's resources and current situation. It focuses on DPS abilities only, excluding buffs, healing, and damage mitigation. * Single-Button Assistant: This feature provides a single button to cast the next recommended damage-dealing ability in sequence. It includes a small additional global cooldown between abilities and can detect when to use AoE or multi-target spells. Both features are designed to help new players, those trying new specializations, or players seeking additional guidance and accessibility options.

• Assisted Highlight will suggest the next recommended damage ability based on situational resources.

  • A small additional global cooldown is applied between abilities when using the Single-Button Assistant.
  • The Single-Button Assistant will also detect and cast appropriate Area of Effect (AoE) or multi-target spells when applicable.
